message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.DS

The paper deals with the problem of identifying the source of a signal in a network, which is a common problem in network science. The paper proposes a new method called Network Infusion (NI) that is designed to work with large, complex real-world networks. The paper also discusses the effectiveness of NI on synthetic networks and a real-data application. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing), and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Additionally, the paper also deals with network inference, which falls under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
